intro: Pultenaea alea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pultenaea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a glossy green. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in clusters and blooming in spring. Pultenaea alea is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
